name: Venezuela
currentCrisisSummary:
Venezuela endures a protracted humanitarian catastrophe driven by the disastrous interaction of **US-led economic warfare** and **catastrophic internal state failure**. Deep economic collapse‚Äîcaused by **state mismanagement, corruption, authoritarianism**, and then deliberately intensified by **unilateral US sanctions**‚Äîhas shattered public services, caused acute shortages, and fuelled mass displacement.

The '**maximum pressure**' campaign (**oil embargo**, **asset freezes**) crippled state revenue, amplifying the damage already inflicted by internal policy failures. This combination of **external coercion** and **internal decay** functions as **collective punishment**, reversing social gains and deepening poverty.

imperialRoot.imperialPower: Spain (16th c. - 19th c.), US (20th c. - present)
imperialRoot.legacy:
Venezuela's vulnerability lies in its history as a resource-exporting periphery. The **Spanish Empire** established an **extractive colonial economy**. Post-independence, **US** corporations dominated Venezuela's **oil industry**, shaping it into a **petro-state dependent** on oil revenues/US markets.

This enriched **foreign capital** and local elites but prevented sovereign development. The **Bolivarian Revolution's** attempts (since 1999) to assert national control were met with US hostility (**failed coup** 2002) but also suffered from profound **internal mismanagement**, ultimately leading to **US economic warfare** and state collapse.

historicalContext.title: The Resource Curse and Dependency
historicalContext.description: Oil wealth was a **structural vulnerability**. The economy was fundamentally **dependent** on oil exports, a legacy of **US domination** deepened by Bolivarian policies. This dependency was the precise weakness **US sanctions** exploited. Targeting oil income *after* internal mismanagement had already crippled production induced near-total **economic collapse**.

historicalContext.title: Internal Economic Mismanagement
historicalContext.description: Long before the harshest US sanctions (2017), the Venezuelan state pursued **disastrous economic policies**. This included **unsustainable price and currency controls** generating shortages and black markets; **systematic expropriations** destroying the private sector; **rampant mismanagement and corruption within the state oil company (PDVSA)** causing production collapse; and **reckless fiscal spending** leading to hyperinflation *before* the US oil embargo.

historicalContext.title: State Authoritarianism and Repression
historicalContext.description: Parallel to the economic decline, the state under Ch√°vez and Maduro became increasingly **authoritarian**. This involved the **systematic dismantling of democratic institutions** (judiciary, electoral council, legislature), **persecution of political opponents**, **censorship** of independent media, and **brutal state violence** against protesters. The **highly contested 2018 election** deepened the legitimacy crisis, providing a pretext for further US intervention.

historicalContext.title: State Corruption
historicalContext.description: The Bolivarian era fostered **endemic state corruption** on a massive scale. Billions of dollars in oil revenues were siphoned off through opaque **currency exchange systems**, **embezzlement within PDVSA**, and **patronage networks**. This **kleptocracy** crippled public services, destroyed state capacity, and fuelled popular anger, contributing significantly to the economic collapse.

historicalContext.title: US Economic Warfare (Sanctions)
historicalContext.description: Since 2014 (escalating 2017), the US imposed comprehensive **sanctions** ‚Äì a broad **financial and sectoral blockade**. Measures prohibit state oil company trade, block credit, and enabled **seizure of overseas assets**. UN Rapporteurs conclude **sanctions** caused catastrophic decline and **excess deaths**, functioning as **collective punishment**.

historicalContext.title: International Law and Accountability
historicalContext.description: **Unilateral sanctions** are widely considered illegal under **international law**, violating principles of **sovereignty** and **non-intervention**. Venezuela has filed complaints arguing they constitute a **crime against humanity**. The **US-led recognition** of a parallel '**interim government**' provided a legal pretext for **asset seizure**, undermining international law. **UN Special Rapporteurs** have documented how sanctions violate basic **human rights**. **Accountability** for these violations is hindered by the **selective application** of international law by powerful states.

humanitarianImpact.title: Excess Deaths
humanitarianImpact.description: Tens of thousands estimated since 2017, attributable to the combined effects of **state collapse** and **US sanctions** restricting access to food, medicine, and healthcare.

humanitarianImpact.title: Affected Population
humanitarianImpact.description: Est. 19 million require aid due to **economic devastation inflicted by both state failure and the US blockade.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Food Insecurity
humanitarianImpact.description: Est. 15.5 million suffer food insecurity, caused by **internal hyperinflation, production collapse**, and **sanctions blocking imports.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Refugee Crisis
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 7.7 million forced abroad by the **economic catastrophe engineered by state mismanagement and US sanctions**, compounded by **political repression**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Healthcare Collapse
humanitarianImpact.description: Health system collapsed due to **state failure, corruption, emigration of staff**, exacerbated by **sanctions blocking resources**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Extreme Poverty
humanitarianImpact.description: Extreme poverty surged (est. >80%) as **internal mismanagement and sanctions dismantled the economy**.

timeline.event: **Oil Discovery**: Large-scale oil reserves are discovered, rapidly transforming Venezuela into a petro-state dominated by foreign corporations.
**El Caracazo**: A popular uprising against IMF-mandated neoliberal austerity measures is brutally repressed by the state, killing hundreds and exposing the illegitimacy of the old political order.

**Hugo Ch√°vez Elected**: Hugo Ch√°vez is elected president on an anti-neoliberal and anti-imperialist platform, initiating the Bolivarian Revolution to assert national sovereignty and redirect oil wealth towards social programmes.
**US-Backed Coup Attempt**: A coup d'√©tat briefly removes Ch√°vez from power. The US government is shown to have had prior knowledge and provided support to the coup plotters.
**Economic Mismanagement Deepens**: Unsustainable policies (currency/price controls, expropriations, PDVSA decay) accelerate, leading to shortages and inflation well before peak US sanctions.

**State Repression Intensifies**: The government responds to growing dissent with increasing authoritarianism, including crackdowns on protests (e.g., 2014, 2017), political imprisonments, and erosion of democratic institutions.

**US Economic Blockade ('Maximum Pressure')**: The US imposes crippling sectoral sanctions targeting Venezuela's oil industry and financial system, causing a catastrophic economic contraction and humanitarian crisis.
**Contested Presidential Election**: Nicol√°s Maduro secures re-election in a vote widely condemned internationally as illegitimate, deepening the political crisis.

**Parallel Government & Asset Seizure**: The US and allies recognise an opposition leader as "interim president," a move used to justify the seizure of billions in Venezuelan state assets held abroad.

donate.description: A well-established national aid organisation delivering food, healthcare and nutritional support directly to communities across the country.

advocacy.title: Lift Unilateral Sanctions
advocacy.description: Demand an immediate and unconditional lifting of broad unilateral economic sanctions that collectively punish the civilian population.

advocacy.title: Return Seized State Assets
advocacy.description: Advocate for the unfreezing and return of all Venezuelan state assets held in foreign banks and jurisdictions.

advocacy.title: Support Democratic Rights & Dialogue
advocacy.description: Support the Venezuelan people's right to democracy, free expression, and peaceful protest, and encourage negotiated political solutions to the internal crisis.

advocacy.title: Oppose Foreign Intervention
advocacy.description: Oppose all forms of foreign military or political intervention and support sovereign, diplomatic solutions to internal political disputes.

advocacy.title: Amplify Reports on Sanctions & Repression
advocacy.description: Amplify reports documenting both the devastating human impact of economic coercion *and* the internal state repression and human rights violations.

reading.description: Eduardo Galeano's foundational text detailing the history of colonial and imperialist exploitation in Latin America, essential context for Venezuela.
